main event: Four silver disc-shaped objects were observed flying in formation at high speed over Kansas City, Kansas on May 23, 1957.
interesting points: The objects broke formation at one point, with two of them veering off before rejoining the others.
The objects were able to clear the sky in only 4 minutes.
The objects were observed by five civilian witnesses.
Two of the objects had part of their surface painted red, while the color of the others was unknown.
There were two engine aircraft flying in the vicinity during the sighting.
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
